content.description:
Substitutes fun 5.11 moves at the start of

Hellraiser

for the thin opening moves of

Straight to Hell

.
content.location:
Clip the first bolt of

Hellraiser

to attain the ledge.  Then clip the next three bolts of

Hellraiser

and traverse left to

Straight to Hell

.

content.description:
A sustained line with no real rests, the moves are more straightforward than

Hellraiser

, but more difficult.
content.location:
To attain the ledge, clip the first bolt of

Hellraiser

, then follow the line of bolts to the left of

Hellraiser

to the

Hellraiser

anchor.

content.description: This unique route starts with interesting 5.11 climbing to the first crux, followed by a series of strenuous stems to an overlap, above which no-rest power-endurance moves lead to the anchors.
content.location: Locate a large ledge, the approach to which is protected by a single bolt.  Clip the bolt, climb to the ledge, and then head up the line of bolts leading straight to the so-called Hell Cave, really just an overlap, 40 feet up.  Continue above the overlap past a couple more bolts, to the anchors.
